intro: Aylostera malochii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, evergreen shrub with upright stems and clustered foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and are often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Aylostera malochii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
